pageTitle: Itinerary for Wednesday May 24, and Thursday, May 25, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Wednesday May 24, and Thursday, May 25, 2017:

Wednesday, May 24, 2017

Ottawa, Ontario 

9:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will depart for Brussels, Belgium.

Canada Reception Centre
Hangar 11
190 Convair Private
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity only
  • Media should arrive no later than 8:00 a.m.

Brussels, Belgium

10:10 p.m. The Prime Minister will arrive in Brussels, Belgium and be greeted by His Excellency Charles Michel, Prime Minister of Belgium; Mr. Olivier Nicoloff, Ambassador of Canada to Belgium and Luxembourg; Ms. Kerry Buck, Ambassador and Permanent Representative to the North Atlantic Council; Mr. St√©phane Dion, Ambassador to Germany and Special Envoy to the European Union and Europe; and Lieutenant Colonel Jean-Louis Lejeune, Commander of Melsbroek Military Airbase.

Melsbroek Military Airbase

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity of arrival


Thursday, May 25, 2017

Brussels, Belgium

12:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with His Excellency Jens Stoltenberg, Secretary General of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

NATO Headquarters

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

1:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a media availability.

Luns Press Theatre
NATO Headquarters

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

3:10 p.m. The Prime Minister will arrive at the Public Square Entrance of the new NATO Headquarters.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

3:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the Leaders Reception.

Closed to media.

4:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the unveiling of the 9/11-Article 5 and Berlin Wall Memorials.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

4:35 p.m. The Prime Minister will take part in the Official NATO Leaders Family Photo.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

4:40 p.m. The Prime Minister will walk through the agora of the new NATO Headquarters with NATO Leaders, accompanied by the Secretary General.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity only

5:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the Handover Ceremony of the

North Atlantic Council Meeting.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

5:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the North Atlantic Council Working Dinner.

Note for media:

  • Host broadcaster only for public opening remarks by NATO Secretary General and Belgian Prime Minister

10:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will depart Brussels for Sigonella, Italy.

Closed to media.


Note: all times local
